Featured News

Justia Accomplishments in 2020 – Year in Review

In the future, 2020 will be seen as a symbol of change, adversity, adaptation, and resilience. At Justia, we overcame the challenges of this year and were able to complete projects and launch new initiatives as part of our commitment to consumers and the legal community.

Justia Accomplishments in 2020

2020 Year in Review – Highlights of Legal Developments

While it may be hard to look past this tumultuous year, the legal developments of 2020 could shape the rights and obligations of Americans for years or even decades to come. Some of the notable events involved the coronavirus pandemic, while others had broader implications.

2020 Year in Review – SEO

Throughout 2020, we saw a remarkable amount of changes that affected search engine optimization. In this blog post, we will round up some of the most relevant stories in SEO's constantly evolving world. We can certainly predict that 2021 is coming stronger than ever, so in this post, we elaborate on our take for the coming year too.

2020 Year in Review – Local SEO

The landscape for local businesses changed drastically due to the restrictive measures imposed everywhere while trying to keep this virus at bay. The COVID-19 pandemic has taught business owners that they need to adapt and change how they communicate and reach customers.

2020 Year in Review – Google’s Paid Advertising Platforms

The year 2020 will most certainly be a year that we will all remember. Society was challenged by something that most of us had never seen in our lifetimes. Through it all, we've overcome adversity and the pandemic has shown businesses the importance of online communications and how invaluable it is to get the right message to the right audience.

2020 Year in Review – Web Design Trends

The year 2020 was packed with new trends full of creativity and innovation in web design. While some will fade away, others are definitely here to stay. Most of these trends were distinguished by attaining a perfect balance between a responsible design (which cares about usability and accessibility features) and a daring design that is very attractive to the visitor. Here is a list of some of these trends for your analysis and inspiration.

2020 Year in Review – Social Media Trends: More Growth, More Misinformation, and More Money-Making

Social media had a year of incredible growth despite various controversies. From TikTok to Facebook to LinkedIn, all the big companies developed new features and found ways to encourage commerce across their platforms.

2020 Year in Review – Marketing During COVID-19 and the Move to Virtual Meetings, Spaces & Entertainment

2020 was a year out of the ordinary. It was a year that, with social distancing and the home office, brought a rethinking of how people had to connect at work, professionally, at school, and with their families. The digital world was also affected, and the strategies that companies have used have changed as they adapt to the "new" communications methods of digital platforms, applications, and devices. We review some of these changes and how they became part of people's lives during this extraordinary time.

Tech News

U.S. Vs. Facebook: Inside the Tech Giant’s Behind-the-Scenes Campaign to Battle Back Antitrust Lawsuits

As state and federal investigators prepared to sue Facebook, the company responded by increasing lobbying, hiring elite lawyers, and launching numerous internal initiatives.

Google’s Antitrust Cases: A Guide for the Perplexed

The tech giant faces three lawsuits by the US Department of Justice and 36 states, attacking its alleged monopoly over search, search advertising, and general digital advertising.

Ripple Faces a SEC Lawsuit for Breaking Investor-Protection Laws When Selling XRP

Federal regulators are suing cryptocurrency firm Ripple over its sale of a digital asset that is considered an unlicensed security but may be a cryptocurrency outside regulatory control.

Salesforce to Acquire Slack for $27.7 Billion

The biggest deal in the history of Salesforce caps a series of aggressive acquisitions by the software company and ends the existence of Slack as an independent publicly traded entity.

Google AI Ethics Co-Lead Timnit Gebru Says She Was Fired Over an Email

The email from one of the world’s leading AI researchers reportedly expressed frustration with the lack of progress in hiring women at Google and the lack of accountability for this failure.

Google Illegally Fired And Spied On Workers Who Tried To Organize, Labor Agency Says

Google allegedly fired two employees involved in labor organizing, took adverse actions against other employees, enforced rules unfairly, and systematically discouraged organizing.

SEO News

Google Explains Discovery & Refresh Data in Crawl Stats Report

Discovered URLs were crawled by Google for the first time, while refreshed URLs had been previously crawled but were crawled again to update information in Google’s search index.

Google December 2020 Core Update Is Now Fully Rolled Out

This global update had a significant impact, resulting in gains or declines of 10 percent to over 100 percent of previous levels of search traffic for sites in many regions and categories.

YouTube Remains Dominant Source of Video in Top Google Ranking Positions

Although Google has denied that it gives a preference to YouTube over other video content, a study found that over 80 percent of videos in its search results carousel come from YouTube.

Google on Penalizing Misinformation

Marketing insiders have questioned why Google applies only automated penalties to sites that spread misinformation, while it applies both automated and manual penalties to spam.

Justia Company Page Gets a New Look in 2020

We’ve recently updated our Justia Company Page where we have made available our company announcements and information about the leadership team behind our strategy and business operations. Social Media News

Twitter Acquires Screen-Sharing Social App Squad

While the co-founders and team of Squad will join Twitter’s design, engineering, and product departments, Twitter has shut down the Squad app in a move similar to its shutdown of Vine.

LinkedIn Begins Testing Ads in LinkedIn Stories

After it released LinkedIn Stories to all users in September, LinkedIn has started to test Stories Ads with a limited number of advertisers in a closed beta with all members globally.

Twitter Reverts to Traditional Retweet Process After Switching It Up for the US Election

The social media network had temporarily removed straight retweeting as an option in the US in October, requiring users to quote tweets, but this reduced sharing and user engagement.

Instagram Adds New Prompts to Help Stop Resurgences of COVID-19

Users in areas with surging cases will see a prompt connecting them to health authorities at the top of their feeds, while the quality of COVID-19 or vaccine search results will improve.

FTC Orders Amazon, Facebook, Twitter and TikTok to Provide Details on Personal Data, Advertising

Several social media and streaming sites must provide information about personal data usage and advertising and user engagement practices, including their impact on children and teens.

LinkedIn Adds New 'Products' Tab on Company Pages to Highlight Specific Products

Companies can use the new feature for purposes such as spotlighting endorsements and testimonials, collecting ratings and reviews, and generating leads with a call to action button.

Justia Lawyer Rating and Reviews

Featured Lawyer

John Espinosa

LOWELL, MA

Justia Lawyer Rating and Reviews is a system designed for lawyers to provide valuable insight from peers and colleagues personally familiar with the lawyer’s work.

Lawyers who have received reviews will have a badge on their profile showing their Justia Lawyer Rating, a numerical representation of the reviews they have received. Our research shows that the Rating Badge is the most used search filter in the Justia Lawyer Directory.

Don’t miss out on your chance to showcase your Justia Lawyer Rating badge on your websites, blogs, and other properties!
Read More

Legal Industry News

House Passes Bill to Make PACER Free as Judiciary Opposes

Supporters of the bill assert that technology is essential to preserve access to justice and court records, while detractors point to its budgetary and operational impact on federal courts.

Federal Courts Participate in Audio Livestream Pilot

As part of a two-year pilot program, 13 district courts will livestream real-time courtroom audio of select proceedings in civil cases of public interest on their designated YouTube channels.

Employers Can Require Workers to Get Covid-19 Vaccine, U.S. Says

Federal disability laws that protect the medical privacy of employees do not prevent employers from barring employees from the workplace if they refuse the COVID-19 vaccine.

Supreme Court Has Golden Opportunity To Rein In NCAA ‘Amateurism’

The Supreme Court granted review of a Ninth Circuit decision that addresses whether the college sports industry may enforce amateurism rules that forbid paying college athletes.

Justia's Tim Stanley and Stacy Stern Discuss 25 Years of Making Law Free

Tim Stanley and Stacy Stern were recently highlighted on Bob Ambrogi's LawSites blog. The post includes a podcast where they discuss how they came to start FindLaw, sell the company to West, start again with Justia, their future plans, and their thoughts on the progress we’ve made in 25 years of providing free access to law. A Pug’s Tale

Sheba Snuggles

During the chilly winter days, Sheba loves to snuggle in blankets with her stuffies. She's looking forward to more naps and adventure walks in the new year.

Internet Stats

Search Engine Market Share

(November 2020)

Source: StatCounter

With a more than 90 percent market share in 2020, Google is undoubtedly the most popular search engine on the planet. Thus, Google should be at the center of your digital marketing strategy, whether it is in the form of SEO or PPC (or both).

JurisPro Expert Witness Directory

JurisPro provides a free directory of expert witnesses in over 10,000 areas of expertise.

Hospital Administration Expert Witness Testimony Allowed in Assault and Battery Litigation

The U.S. District Court of Florida allowed a Hospital Administration Expert Witness to testify regarding claims of assault and battery.

Bicycle Expert Witness Allowed to Testify in Railroad Crossing Case

A Bicycle Expert Witness was allowed to testify as to the cause of a bicycle accident when a Plaintiff's tire lodged in a railroad crossing.

Oncology Expert Witness Testimony Not Allowed in Case Involving Federal Employers Liability Act Claim

An Oncology Expert Witness was not allowed to testify in a toxic court case as the court found his opinions were based on guesswork and assumption.

Environmental Engineering Expert Witness Testimony Allowed in Environmental Contamination Case

Defendant's Environmental Engineering Expert Witness could testify on the alleged damages caused by an industrial facility.
